name: Vegan Yellow Cake
description: Spongey and fluffy ​​Vegan Yellow Cake without any eggs! Covered in a rich vegan chocolate frosting, this is the ultimate birthday cake that looks, tastes, and feels just like the classic version.
recipeIngredient: 3/4 cup neutral flavored oil (I used avocado oil)

itemListElement.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F and spray two 8 or 9 inch cake pans with oil. I also like to place a circle of round parchment paper in the bottom to prevent the cakes from sticking to the pans.
itemListElement.name: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F and spray two 8 or 9 inch cake pans with oil. I also like to place a circle of round parchment paper in the bottom to prevent the cakes from sticking to the pans.

itemListElement.text: In a large mixing bowl, whisk the flour, baking powder, salt, turmeric and sugar together until well combined.
itemListElement.name: In a large mixing bowl, whisk the flour, baking powder, salt, turmeric and sugar together until well combined.

itemListElement.text: To the same bowl, pour in the oil, soy milk, apple cider vinegar and vanilla. Mix with the dry ingredients using a large spoon until just combined. Be careful not to over mix, or the cake won't be as soft. (You can also use a stand mixer with the whisk attachment.)
itemListElement.name: To the same bowl, pour in the oil, soy milk, apple cider vinegar and vanilla. Mix with the dry ingredients using a large spoon until just combined. Be careful not to over mix, or the cake won't be as soft. (You can also use a stand mixer with the whisk attachment.)

itemListElement.text: Divide the batter evenly between the cake pans and bake for 30-35 minutes, until a toothpick inserted in the middle comes out clean.
itemListElement.name: Divide the batter evenly between the cake pans and bake for 30-35 minutes, until a toothpick inserted in the middle comes out clean.

itemListElement.text: Let the cakes cool in the pans for about 10 minutes, then carefully pop them out and place on a cooling rack. You must allow the cakes to cool completely before frosting.
itemListElement.name: Let the cakes cool in the pans for about 10 minutes, then carefully pop them out and place on a cooling rack. You must allow the cakes to cool completely before frosting.

itemListElement.text: Once the cakes are cooled, frost with chocolate frosting as desired. Pipe additional frosting on top and add colorful sprinkles, if desired.
itemListElement.name: Once the cakes are cooled, frost with chocolate frosting as desired. Pipe additional frosting on top and add colorful sprinkles, if desired.

itemListElement.text: Serve and enjoy! The cake will keep at room temperature for 2-3 days, or up to 1 week in the refrigerator. It can also be frozen. Wrap or cover cut parts of the cake to avoid it drying out.
itemListElement.name: Serve and enjoy! The cake will keep at room temperature for 2-3 days, or up to 1 week in the refrigerator. It can also be frozen. Wrap or cover cut parts of the cake to avoid it drying out.
